content: आधारः [आ-धृ घञ्; आध्रियंतेऽस्मिन्क्रियाः इति <ls>Kāśi.</ls>] {@--1@} Support, prop, stay; <ls>Mu. 1. 2.</ls> {@--2@} (Hence) Power of sustaining, aid, patronage, assistance; त्वमेव चातकाधारः <ls>Bh. 2. 50.</ls> {@--3@} A receptacle, reservoir; तिष्ठंत्याप इवाधारे <ls>Pt. 1. 67</ls>; चराचराणां भूतानां कुक्षिराधारतां गतः <ls>Ku. 6. 67</ls>; अपामिवाधारमनुत्तरंगं <ls>Ku. 3. 48</ls>; तोयाधारपथाश्च वल्कलशिखानिष्यंदरेखांकिताः <ls>Ś. 1. 14</ls>; आधारः क्षमांभसां <ls>K. 44</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 144</ls>, <ls n="Y. 3.">165.</ls> {@--4@} That which holds or contains, a vessel, recipient. {@--5@} A part, character (in dramas); <ls>Mv. 1. 3.</ls> {@--6@} A basin round the foot of a tree; आधारबंधप्रमुखैः प्रयत्नैः <ls>R. 5. 6.</ls> {@--7@} A dike, dam, embankment. {@--8@} A canal. {@--9@} The sense of the locative case, location, comprehension; आधारोऽधिकरणं; (आधार is of {3} kinds: --औपश्लेषिक, वैषयिक, and अभिव्यापक see <ls>Sk.</ls> on <ls>P. I. 4. 45</ls>). {@--10@} Relation.
